channel.title: Pheonix blade 1.0 Updated
channel.description:
Hey, this is my pheonix blade i will be doing minor updates to make it look better i think it looks better without colro but i have a color and non-color copy.
Color [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/69hutv.png[/img]
Wireframe [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/k3p16p.png[/img]
Jusy model no color [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/2e22mp5.png[/img]\
***UPDATE***
[IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/1e8n52.png[/img]
I think i got it pretty good that time.
Please Constructive critisism only, no flaming please.

item.title: Pheonix blade 1.0 Updated
item.dc:creator: @DraculeMihawk DraculeMihawk
item.description:
@DraculeMihawk wrote:

Thats if your hitting a shield or another sword… In runescape you dont hit shieldsc well you dont see it if you do.

Read full topic

item.title: Pheonix blade 1.0 Updated
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Tribbinator, post:30, topic:359181”][quote]
As with any sword, when struck, it will vibrate. Some swords may handle well but do not have sufficient shock dissipation control. In other words when a sword impacts the target, the shock transfer to the grip can be so great that it can be painful holding it. A badly-vibrating sword can be difficult to control in a fight.
A poorly designed sword - no matter how beautiful in appearance - can suffer vibrational problems and thus adversely impact handling.

-http://swordforum.com/sfu/primer/wellmade.html
[/quote]

Its not about the properties of the handle at this point…The whole structure of the sword matters…And with that handle, you are going to drop it.[/quote]

Did you just make that?

Read full topic

item.title: Pheonix blade 1.0 Updated
item.dc:creator: @Tribbinator Tribbinator
item.description:
@Tribbinator wrote:

Exactly, I just wanted to end the argument about vibration in a metal handle, Bahah.

Read full topic

item.title: Pheonix blade 1.0 Updated
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

also one thing :\ these “weapons” are suppost to be for Runescape private servers… Handles are hardly seen O-o only the yip and the sides so what color or material dosent really matter since “RUnescape” is the farthest thing to real there is

Read full topic

item.title: Pheonix blade 1.0 Updated
item.dc:creator: @Tribbinator Tribbinator
item.description:
@Tribbinator wrote:

As with any sword, when struck, it will vibrate. Some swords may handle well but do not have sufficient shock dissipation control. In other words when a sword impacts the target, the shock transfer to the grip can be so great that it can be painful holding it. A badly-vibrating sword can be difficult to control in a fight. A poorly designed sword - no matter how beautiful in appearance - can suffer vibrational problems and thus adversely impact handling.

-http://swordforum.com/sfu/primer/wellmade.html



Its not about the properties of the handle at this point…The whole structure of the sword matters…And with that handle, you are going to drop it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@DraculeMihawk wrote:

Haha i saw this and lol’d a metal handle wouldnt vibrate through a PERSON and if it does just rap tape like off a baseball bat that would lose the friction. Evan though my model does suck. ^^

item.title: Pheonix blade 1.0 Updated
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“kirikugi, post:27, topic:359181”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=455669.msg3341808#msg3341808 date=1284433401]

picks up sword oh look at that. The handle broke. And hilt needs some work. Like rip4d said.
[/quote] you do know just becuase the handle is skinny does not mean it will break <.<…
it depends how strong the metal is.

Handles aren’t made out of metal because when you would swing your sword the sword would vibrate and most likely you would drop the sword. If it was made out of metal it would bend.

yes becuase everyone knows strong metal bends without heat roles eyes and for vibrations. thats what good gloves are for, and strong arms.

in thoughs days weeklings were Hunters for food, you wernt alowd to be in the military if all youw ould do is die waste of metals

Dude the metal would vibrate. That’s how life works. When you hit a symbol on a drum with a drumstick, the entire symbol vibrates and bends as a shock wave flies through it. Learned this from the discovery channel lol.

this is very true…and if the metal hit another metal object it would vibrate and most likely make you want to drop it …think of a weed eaters vibration and times it bye 10 maybe…thats how bad it would be…i shud know me and my brothers were stupid enough to try it…and trust me…swinging at full capacity hurts your hands alot…even with good gloves[/quote]

Lol wow. Anyway, the point is is that you shouldn’t use a metal handle.

Read full topic

item.title: Pheonix blade 1.0 Updated
item.dc:creator: @DraculeMihawk DraculeMihawk
item.description:
@DraculeMihawk wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:13, topic:359181”][quote author=tubefish link=topic=455669.msg3336356#msg3336356 date=1283951223]
you put that it was your phoenix blade
and what do you mean
i hope you get infracted
[/quote]What are you talking about? It may not have been his idea, but its still his model. And hoping someone “gets infracted” just makes you look like an ass.

For the model, make the handle curve inwards, just make sure the whole handle is wider so it looks stable.[/quote]

I tried that but it made it look awkward so i made it curve outwards, and i was hoping the guy got infracted for posting because all he does is flame.

Read full topic
